required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intensive Medicines Monitoring Study of Toripalimab Monoclonal Injection (Tuoyi) .
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Single-arm, Multicenter, Non-interventional Real-world Study of Toripalimab Injection in the Treatment of Malignant Tumors in Chinese Population.

brief_summary.textblock: This study was a prospective, single-arm, multi-channel, multicenter, non-interventional real-world study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Toripalimab injection in the treatment of unresectable or metastatic melanoma with previously systemic failure . The study population currently included only in the melanoma cohort-unresectable or metastatic melanoma patients who had previously failed systemic therapy. If new indications are approved during the implementation of the project, patients with new indications using Toripalimab injection will also be included in this study as a new cohort.This study uses offline (physical hospital) and online (DTP pharmacy and Lingke (Yinchuan) Internet hospital) to collect data and information, relying on Lingke technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd. EDC (Medical Research Cloud) database for data collection and processing. The classification of adverse events was based on the general toxicity evaluation standard NCI CTCAE 5.0 of the National Institute of Oncology (Chinese version).

primary_outcome.description: the incidence of all ADR: the number and percentage of patients with ADR, and the number of ADR events will be summarized according to the International Medical Dictionary (MedDRA) preferred terminology and adverse events General terminology Standard (NCI CTCAE5.0 Chinese version). Any ADR collected during the study will be included in the ADR summary.
The incidence of known adverse reactions ((ADR)).

primary_outcome.measure: The occurrence of new adverse reactions ((ADR)
primary_outcome.description: The occurrence of new adverse reactions ((ADR)).
The incidence, severity and risk factors of severe adverse reactions ((SADR)).
The incidence, severity and risk factors of immune-related adverse reactions.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of adverse drug reactions ((ADR)) in special populations.

secondary_outcome.description: the incidence of all adverse events (AE); the incidence of different severity AE;
The incidence of severe adverse events (SAE):
The incidence, severity of immune-related adverse events;
Survival indicators: overall survival (OS); 1 -, 2 -, 3-year OS rate.

arm_group.description: Use of Toripalimab injection in the real world

intervention.description: 240 mg/6 mL/vial. The recommended dose of Toripalima is 3 mg/kg, intravenous infusion every 2 weeks until disease progression or intolerable toxicity.

study_pop.textblock: The study population currently included only in the melanoma cohort-unresectable or metastatic melanoma patients who had previously failed systemic therapy. If new indications are approved during the implementation of the project, patients with new indications using Toripalimab injection will also be included in this study as a new cohort.
